intro: Cheiridopsis umbrosa, commonly known as the dark sand verbena, is a succulent plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its fleshy leaves and unique flower structures. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are usually blue-green in color and form a dense rosette. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
